result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nathan R Bjurstrom not in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Nathan R Bjurstrom. Prosecuting attorney Kylan Reilly in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel informs the Court he would be requesting an adjournment. Discussion held off the record. State does not object. Case is adjourned back to OCCR.
Return on warrant scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No reply from defendant or surety. th

Defendant Nathan R Bjurstrom not in court. 
The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 11-02-2022.
Return on warrant scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($1,000.00) LW

Defendant Nathan R Bjurstrom not in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Nathan R Bjurstrom.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a status. DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Defense has no explanation for defendants non appearance. Court vacates the plea and sentencing date. Court ordered bench warrant issued, remand to the JUDGE, and forfeiture of bond.
Justice Point Pretrial Services DISCHARGE Report received and filed.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court, defendant Nathan R Bjurstrom not in court, in custody.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Calendar Call held.  Defense counsel advises Court that defendant is incustody in Sheboygan County.  Court vacates previously stayed bench warrant.  Defense counsel requests in person plea and sentencing hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case calendared for a Pretrial Conference. DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. 
Defense counsel advises the court defendant had an emergency dental procedure and request an additional calendar call date.  
Court ordered bench warrant issued, remand to the Commissioner and no action on bail and STAYED issuance until the next court date.
Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Calendar call scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court.  Hira Najvot appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case calendared for a Pretrial Conference.
Defendant failed to appear. Defense in reciept fo digital disovery in this case and waiting for police report and an Offer from the State.
State will follow up.   Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Calendar call scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.


Defendant appeared later and provided the next court date.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Pre-trial conference on July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

22RM028709  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/06/2022 sa

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision Level 3.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Nathan R Bjurstrom in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Nathan R Bjurstrom in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nathan R Bjurstrom appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  
This hearing may be streamed live through DACAST at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
